places.name: Kathmandu Durbar Square
places.description: Historic royal palace complex and UNESCO World Heritage Site in the heart of Kathmandu.
places.detail: Kathmandu Durbar Square showcases exquisite Newari architecture dating back to the 12th-18th centuries. The complex includes ancient temples, courtyards, and the former royal palace. The site remains an active religious and cultural center.

details.subtitle: Construction Period
details.text: Developed between 12th-18th centuries by Malla and Shah kings

details.subtitle: 2015 Earthquake
details.text: Several monuments were damaged but reconstruction is ongoing

details.subtitle: Cultural Hub
details.text: Hosts major festivals like Indra Jatra and Dashain celebrations

details.subtitle: Tourism Center
details.text: One of Nepal's most visited heritage sites

travelTips: Hire a licensed guide for historical insights
Visit early morning to avoid crowds

places.name: Pashupatinath Temple
places.description: Sacred Hindu temple complex dedicated to Lord Shiva on the banks of Bagmati River.
places.detail: Pashupatinath is one of the most important Shiva temples in the world, dating back to 400 AD. The sprawling complex includes numerous shrines, ashrams, and cremation ghats. It's particularly significant during Maha Shivaratri festival.

details.subtitle: Ancient Origins
details.text: Mentioned in ancient Hindu scriptures dating to 400 AD

details.subtitle: Architectural Style
details.text: Classic pagoda style with gold-plated roof and silver doors

details.subtitle: Pilgrimage Site
details.text: Attracts hundreds of thousands of Hindu pilgrims annually

details.subtitle: Cultural Heritage
details.text: UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1979

places.name: Boudhanath Stupa
places.description: One of the largest spherical stupas in the world and center of Tibetan Buddhism.
places.detail: Built in the 5th century, Boudhanath is a massive mandala-style stupa surrounded by monasteries and shops selling Tibetan artifacts. The site is particularly atmospheric during prayer times when monks circle the stupa chanting mantras.

details.subtitle: Construction
details.text: Built by Licchavi king Manadeva in 5th century

details.subtitle: Refugee Influence
details.text: Tibetan refugees expanded the area after 1959

details.subtitle: Religious Center
details.text: Heart of Tibetan Buddhism outside Tibet

details.subtitle: UNESCO Site
details.text: Designated in 1979 along with other Kathmandu Valley sites

places.name: Swayambhunath Stupa
places.description: Ancient hilltop stupa known as the 'Monkey Temple' with panoramic Kathmandu views.
places.detail: Dating back 2,000 years, Swayambhunath is among Nepal's oldest religious sites, combining Buddhist and Hindu elements. The complex includes shrines, temples, and a large Buddha statue amidst hundreds of resident monkeys.

details.subtitle: Origins
details.text: Believed to be self-created 2,000 years ago

details.subtitle: Name Meaning
details.text: Swayambhu means 'self-created' in Sanskrit

details.subtitle: Pilgrimage Site
details.text: Important for both Buddhists and Hindus

details.subtitle: Tourist Attraction
details.text: Offers best panoramic views of Kathmandu

travelTips: Combine visit with nearby National Museum

places.name: Chandragiri Hills
places.description: Scenic hill station with cable car access and Himalayan views near Kathmandu.
places.detail: Chandragiri offers breathtaking views from Manakamana to Everest. The hilltop features Bhaleshwar Mahadev Temple, adventure activities, and the country's first international-standard cable car system.

details.subtitle: Ancient Route
details.text: Was part of historic trade route to India

details.subtitle: Temple Legend
details.text: Bhaleshwar Temple dates back to 17th century

details.subtitle: Tourism Development
details.text: Major recreational destination since cable car opened in 2016

details.subtitle: Viewpoint
details.text: One of best Himalayan viewpoints accessible from Kathmandu

places.name: Nagarkot
places.description: Popular hill station renowned for sunrise views over the Himalayas.
places.detail: Located 32km east of Kathmandu at 2,195m altitude, Nagarkot offers one of the widest Himalayan panoramas from Dhaulagiri to Everest. The area features resorts, hiking trails, and traditional villages.

details.subtitle: Royal History
details.text: Served as summer retreat for Malla and Shah kings

details.subtitle: Strategic Location
details.text: Used as military outpost in medieval times

details.subtitle: Tourism Hub
details.text: Most accessible Himalayan viewpoint from Kathmandu

details.subtitle: Eco-Tourism
details.text: Base for hiking and mountain biking

travelTips: Stay overnight for best sunrise experience

places.name: Bhaktapur Durbar Square
places.description: Well-preserved medieval city with exquisite Newari architecture.
places.detail: Bhaktapur, the 'City of Devotees', retains its ancient character with brick-paved streets and traditional pottery squares. The durbar square complex includes the 55-Window Palace, Nyatapola Temple, and numerous artisan workshops.

details.subtitle: Golden Age
details.text: Flourished as capital of Greater Malla Kingdom 12th-15th century

details.subtitle: Earthquake Resilience
details.text: Suffered less damage in 2015 than Kathmandu's squares

details.subtitle: Living Museum
details.text: UNESCO site maintaining traditional Newari lifestyle

details.subtitle: Craft Preservation
details.text: Center for woodcarving, pottery and thangka painting

travelTips: Purchase entry ticket at main gate
Visit early to see potters at work

places.name: Phulchoki Hill
places.description: Highest hill surrounding Kathmandu valley with rich biodiversity.
places.detail: Rising to 2,782m, Phulchoki is covered in rhododendron forests and offers excellent birdwatching. The hill is sacred to both Hindus and Buddhists, with several small shrines along the forested trails.

details.subtitle: Sacred Site
details.text: Named after the flower (phul) goddess (choki)

details.subtitle: Scientific Study
details.text: Botanical surveys conducted since 19th century

details.subtitle: Birdwatching
details.text: Home to over 265 bird species including endangered spiny babbler

details.subtitle: Nature Retreat
details.text: Popular hiking destination from Kathmandu

travelTips: Hire local guide for bird spotting

places.name: Godavari Botanical Garden
places.description: Royal botanical garden at the foothills of Phulchoki with diverse plant collections.
places.detail: Established in 1962, the 82-hectare garden features over 500 species of plants, including rare orchids, ferns, and medicinal herbs. The garden serves as both recreation space and research center.

details.subtitle: Royal Origins
details.text: Developed as King Mahendra's conservation project

details.subtitle: International Collaboration
details.text: Originally established with German assistance

details.subtitle: Education Center
details.text: Important site for botanical research

details.subtitle: Recreation
details.text: Popular picnic spot with well-maintained paths

travelTips: Visit on weekdays to avoid crowds
Photography permit required for professional equipment

places.name: Panauti
places.description: Charming medieval Newari town with well-preserved temples and traditional architecture.
places.detail: Located at the confluence of two sacred rivers, Panauti is considered one of Nepal's most important historical towns. The settlement retains its medieval street pattern and boasts exquisite woodcarvings in its temples and homes.

details.subtitle: Ancient Settlement
details.text: Dates back to at least 13th century Malla period

details.subtitle: Sacred Geography
details.text: Built at confluence of Roshi and Punyamati rivers

details.subtitle: Cultural Preservation
details.text: UNESCO tentative list site for its intact heritage

details.subtitle: Sustainable Tourism
details.text: Model for community-based heritage tourism
